title: Dev Patel brings his grandfather Maganial to David Copperfield premiere
text:
He's earned critical acclaim thanks to a series of highly-praised roles.

But Dev Patel proved he hasn't forgotten his roots, as he brought his grandfather Maganial to the premiere of his latest film The Personal History Of David Copperfield in London on Wednesday.

The English actor, 29, cut a dapper figure in a grey Gucci suit as he also posed alongside the actors who play his younger self for the red carpet, which also served as the opening night gala for the BFI London Film Festival.

Smart: Dev Patel, 29, cut a dapper figure on Wednesday as he attended the premiere of The Personal History Of David Copperfield (pictured with Jairaj Varsani and Ranveer Jaiswal)

Dev was looking suave as he wrote a sharp grey suit by the designer Gucci for the red carpet.

The Slumdog Millionaire star beamed as he joined his co-stars Jairaj Varsani and Ranveer Jaiswal, who play the younger versions of David Copperfield in the film.

Dev's grandfather couldn't hide his pride as he arrived for the launch. The family have stayed close ever since the former Skins star rose to fame in 2008 as the star of Slumdog Millionaire.

Proud: The Slumdog Millionaire star brought along his grandfather Maganial for the occasion as he celebrate the film's launch on the opening night of the BFI London Film Festival

Happy: Dev was looking suave as he wrote a sharp grey suit by the designer Gucci for the red carpet

Dev completed his look by stepping out in smart black shoes, while he kept his accessories simple by wearing a brown watch.

He wore his raven-tresses in a slicked-back fashion, while he sported a close-cropped beard for a dapper look.

The film chronicles Copperfield's life from youth into adulthood, examining his writing career and many friendships and relationships over the years.

While at the premiere, Dev spoke to American Express about his role in the film, saying: 'It's a story of identity and owning your adversities, [director] Armando is incredible and he really pushed us with the comedy. I bring the awkwardness and the gangly very easily I've always felt like a bit of fish out of water.'

Jovial: He wore his raven-tresses in a slicked-back fashion, while he sported a close-cropped beard for a dapper look

Classic: The film chronicles Copperfield's life from youth into adulthood, examining his writing career and many friendships and relationships over the years

Actors who have played David Copperfield 1966 Ian McKellen 1969 Robin Phillips 1974 David Yelland 1986 Colin Hurley 1993 Julian Lennon 1999 Ciarán McMenamin, Daniel Radcliffe as a young David 2000 Hugh Dancy 2001 David Jason 2019 Dev Patel

The film is based on the classic novel by Charles Dickens, which was serialised between 1849 and 1850.

Alongside Dev, who takes on the titular role, Hugh Laurie, Tilda Swinton and Peter Capaldi also feature in the film.

Director Armando Ianucci told IndieWire he opted for 'colourblind' casting on this film, because he didn't want to be 'bound by the conventions of a costume drama or a period drama.'

He said: 'I want it to feel real and present, even though it’s set in 1840 in London. I want it to feel immediate and current.

'And therefore I want the cast to be much more representative of what London looks like now, and I want a lot of the behavior in the film to feel current and contemporary.'

'You just want to cast the best person, and I honestly couldn’t think of anyone more appropriate to play David Copperfield than Dev.'

The film's director and co-writer also recently said: 'The Personal History Of David Copperfield is a film about compassion, humour, generosity and friendship, and I couldn't have asked for a more welcoming setting in which to premiere it.'

The movie's producer Kevin Loader told The Guardian that Patel was simply the right person for the job.

He said: 'Armando always knew he wanted Dev. Once you realise that, then you’re making a statement about the fact that you’re going to cast actors who are capable of embodying the character as perfectly as possible, regardless of their ethnicity.

'I was standing on the side of the set the other day, watching a scene between three of the younger characters.

'I suddenly realised I was watching three young black British actors in a Dickens adaptation, none of which were written as black characters. And it didn’t seem odd. It’s just another scene in the film.'

The film will follow Copperfield navigate a chaotic world; from his unhappy childhood to the discovery of his gift as a storyteller.

The Personal History Of David Copperfield is released in the UK on 10th January 2020.
